APPLIED CATALYSIS A: GENERAL ELSEVIER Applied Catalysis A: General 165 (1997) 207-218 Influence of 02 and 03 regeneration on the metallic phase of the Pt-Re/AI203 catalyst C.L. Pieck, C.A. Querini, J.M. Parera* lnstituto de lnvestigaciones en Catdlisis y Petroqufmica, 1NCAPE, Santiago del Estero 2654, 3000 Santa Fe, Argentina Received 12 January 1997; received in revised form 27 May 1997: accepted 1 June 1997 Abstract The influence of the regeneration with oxygen or ozone on the metallic function activity of the Pt-Re/AI203 catalyst prepared by catalytic reduction is studied. The interaction between Pt and Re is higher when activation is carried out by direct reduction. However, calcination at 450 leads to a segregation of metals. The regeneration carried out with diluted 02 destroys the metallic interaction producing segregation of Pt and Re, while the regeneration with 03 at low temperature avoids such segregation to a large extent. Ozone not only bums coke off, but also modifies its burning characteristics as measured by temperature programmed oxidation technique (TPO) with 6% O2]N2. It was found that after the 03 treatment, the coke left on the catalyst burns at lower temperatures if compared to the coke without 03 treatment. Therefore, a regeneration treatment can be carried out at low temperatures by combining a first step with 03 followed by a second one with O~ at lower temperatures than those needed in conventional regeneration procedures. /~ 1997 Elsevier Science B.V. Kevwords: Platinum-rhenium; Coke burning; Ozone versus oxygen regeneration; Coke characterization; Metallic phase 1. Riviere, React. Kinet. Catal. Lett. 29 (1985) 323. APCATA 98800136 S0926-860X(98)80013-6 10.1016/S0926-860X(98)80013-6 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved. Influence of O2 and O3 regeneration on the metallic phase of the Pt—Re/Al2O3 catalyst C.L. Pieck C.A. Querini J.M. Parera * Instituto de Investigaciones en Catálisis y Petroquímica, INCAPE, Santiago del Estero 2654, 3000 Santa Fe ,Argentina * Corresponding author. Tel.: +54 42 555279; fax: +54 42 531068 The influence of the regeneration with oxygen or ozone on the metallic function activity of the Pt—Re/Al2O3 catalyst prepared by catalytic reduction is studied. The interaction between Pt and Re is higher when activation is carried out by direct reduction. However, calcination at 450°C leads to a segregation of metals. The regeneration carried out with diluted O2 destroys the metallic interaction producing segregation of Pt and Re, while the regeneration with O3 at low temperature avoids such segregation to a large extent. Ozone not only burns coke off, but also modifies its burning characteristics as measured by temperature programmed oxidation technique (TPO) with 6% O2/N2. It was found that after the O3 treatment, the coke left on the catalyst burns at lower temperatures if compared to the coke without O3 treatment. Therefore, a regeneration treatment can be carried out at low temperatures by combining a first step with O3 followed by a second one with O2 at lower temperatures than those needed in conventional regeneration procedures. The interaction between Pt and Re is higher when activation is carried out by direct reduction. However, calcination at 450°C leads to a segregation of metals. Therefore, a regeneration treatment can be carried out at low temperatures by combining a first step with O3 followed by a second one with O2 at lower temperatures than those needed in conventional regeneration procedures.
coredata.dc:title: Influence of O2 and O3 regeneration on the metallic phase of the Pt—Re/Al2O3 catalyst
